column4: hey guys, i need some help. im about to download ubuntu 7.04 and im on the part where i have to pick the type of computer i have. well its an AMD Athlon 4400+ 64 X2. so should i pick the 64BIT AMD or standard personal computer?
the 64BIT AMD since that is the processor that you had.
allright. will this OS be nicer to me than vista. vista is really really anoying. so im hoping that ubuntu will work better. i play counter strike and many so will ubuntu work for me?
yeah, I just double checked your processor use the 64Bit AMD iso
well, it would depend on if the games you play are compatible with a program in linux called "WINE" Counter-strike fortunately is one of them
if you give me a second, I will get you a guide on making it work in Ubuntu.
allright.
http://www.linux-gamers.net/modules/wiwimod/index.php?page=HOWTO+Steam

the only drawback to using ubuntu at this point in time is that some Windows games don't work on it, or it might take a little bit of work for them to install, since they were made for Windows, not Linux. Everything else however you will find is much better (in my opinion) than Windows, and to top it all off, you get great support (like what we're doing here) and just about ever thing is free.
allright thanks man
For gaming on linux, I'd also check out Cedega ( http://www.transgaming.com/ ) and you're welcome
is the cedega thing free?
seems really easy to use.

Yes and No. If you are willing to get it without support, and with a little extra work, you can get it for free. Otherwise, if you want it to be extremely easy to install with support from transgaming you will have to pay a small monthly fee
I also have a tutorial on doing it the free way if you wish.
can you provide me with that link to your tutorial. and how do i get it for free?
the tutorial explains how to get it for free: http://www.linux-gamers.net/modules/wiwimod/index.php?page=HOWTO+Cedega+CVS
oh okay :)
It looks like the best way to play games with cedega would be to get a subscription. (It costs around as much as a yearly Xbox Live subscription does)
more info here: http://transgaming.org/subscription/subscribe.html
I'm sorry if that was confusing for you :-\
